settingsPane.description: Boot Booster Control. Here you can set boot CPU frequency, after boot done, frequency will be restored to active profile settings.
settingsPane.name: BOOT CPU Frequency

seekBar.description: Boot booster frequency. CPU will hold single min or max frequency when ROM booting, DEAR USER! If your CPU cannot handle 1.5Ghz or 1.6Ghz, setting it here will STUCK your device on boot until you reset profiles via recovery! USE AT YOUR OWN RISK! (default 1.200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: Boot CPU Frequency

seekBar.description: Here you can change Cortex Wakeup Boost. It will give you full CPU power but only for the set time. After that time, all is set back to normal. !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!. When the value is -1, frequency changing is completely deactivated !.
seekBar.name: Cortex Wakeup Boost

settingsPane.description: The following settings are for all global CPU configuration, use it only if you know what you are doing.
settingsPane.name: CPU Global Settings

seekBar.description: Maximum Normal CPU-Speed. CPU Frequency steps by 100.000 kHz, from 100.000 kHz to 1.000.000 kHz! If you want to use OC speeds set here 1.0Ghz and tune the OC bar! If the set speed here is lower than MAX 1.0Ghz, OC bar is ignored! (Default: 1.000.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: Max Normal Frequency

seekBar.description: Overclock CPU Speed. To use OC you must set the Normal CPU speed to MAX 1.0Ghz or this setting ignored! CPU Frequency steps by 100.000 kHz from 1.000.000 kHz to 1.600.000 kHz! ALERT! 1.5 GHz and 1.6 GHz can be unstable for your personal device! Try it and if the phone stuck (SOD), then your CPU will not work on such high frequency and you have to use a lower value! 1.6 Ghz is unstable on 85% of devices, try at your own risk. If device is stuck at boot, reset profile via recovery! (Default: 1.200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: Max OC Frequency

seekBar.description: Minimum CPU-Speed. CPU Frequency step by 100.000 kHz are valid from 100.000 kHz to 1.000.000 kHz! (Default: 200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: Min Frequency

settingsPane.description: These settings control CFS (Complete Fair Scheduler) Task Scheduler Settings
settingsPane.name: CFS Settings

checkbox.description: Disabling GENTLE FAIR SLEEPERS may give you better UI responsiveness, so NOT checked is GOOD.
checkbox.name: GENTLE FAIR SLEEPERS
checkbox.label: GENTLE FAIR SLEEPERS

checkbox.description: Using ARCH POWER enables the use of ARM topology power functions instead of generic ones, and saves battery. Not recommended to disable.
checkbox.name: ARCH POWER
checkbox.label: ARCH POWER

settingsPane.description: Here you can set all the settings for power save!
settingsPane.name: CPU Idle and Power Settings

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode. For best stability use Idle + LPA. (Default: AFTR + LPA)
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode (Sleep Mode). For best stability use Idle + LPA. (Default: AFTR + LPA) !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode (Sleep Mode)

seekBar.description: This is for CPU BUS-FREQ UP-FREQ-Scaling, based on CPU load. It sets the the load threshold on which BUS frequency will rise. (Default: 25%)
seekBar.name: busfreq_up_threshold

seekBar.description: Maximum DEEP SLEEP CPU speed. Samsung default value is 800000kHz. Setting this too low will stuck your device!
seekBar.name: scaling_max_suspend_freq

seekBar.description: Minimum DEEP SLEEP CPU speed. (Default: 200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: scaling_min_suspend_freq

seekBar.description: Minimum STANDBY or ON CALL (on call and screen off) CPU speed. (Default: 200.000 kHz) !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
seekBar.name: scaling_min_standby_freq

settingsPane.description: CPU Voltage Controls. Voltage Range is 800~1500mV. Lower or higher are NOT SUPPORTED. All is done to prevent BUGS and SODS. USE this interface AT YOUR OWN RISK! If you get SOD before you can load this interface and cannot fix your error, reset profiles from recovery. And think harder before you SOD your CPU with too much UV or OV!
settingsPane.name: CPU Voltage Controls

checkbox.description: Main switch for Voltage Control! If disabled, all below settings have no effect! If you are using an external application or script to configure CPU voltage, do not tick this checkbox. Do not start to mod voltage before you enable this switch! It will not make any effect and you will have to set all to default, and tune again!
checkbox.name: CPU Voltage Main Switch
checkbox.label: CPU Voltage Main Switch

button.description: Use this button to see what CPU Voltage Group your CPU is using now, SG2 device has 5 different CPU types around the world, most common is number !3! most stable is number !4! and !5!, number !2! and !1! are old CPU types, they need more voltage to be stable! so if you see that your CPU TYPE !2! or !1!, then dont UV! it is just bad idea, you will get SODS! and cry about it.
button.name: Check CPU Voltage Group
button.label: Check CPU Voltage Group

button.description: Use this button to see what CPU Voltage is used right now!
button.name: Check Active CPU Voltage
button.label: Check CPU Voltage

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1600 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1600 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1500 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1500 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1400 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1400 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1300 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1300 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1200 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1200 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1100 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1100 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1000 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1000 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 900 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 900 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 800 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 800 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 700 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 700MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 600 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 600 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 500 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 500 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 400 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 400 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 300 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 300 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 200 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 200 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 100 MHz.
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 100 MHz

settingsPane.description: Here you can manage advanced governor settings. These settings are active only if the screen is on. !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process and CortexBrain-CPU-Tweaks!!!
settingsPane.name: Governor Parameters tuning

spinner.description: This will set the AWAKE (screen ON) CPU governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution), and can be overridden by any other scripts or applications.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

button.description: Use this button to push all new changes to GOV core in real time! The sleep tuning will be auto added on screen off, to screen off governor.
button.name: GOV Policy Install
button.label: Push CPU Tuning To GOV Core

settingsPane.description: Global Govs Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: GLOBAL GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Measured as percentage, when load on CPU is equal to above up threshold, CPU is scaled Up. Lower value - early scale up, and vice-verse. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Conservative, Scary, Sleepy, zzmoove) (Default: 70%)
seekBar.name: up_threshold

seekBar.description: This threshold is used as up threshold while sampling at frequencies less than freq_for_responsiveness. Above that, normal up_threshold is used. This gives us an option to make scaling aggressive or relaxed until a frequency and normal for higher frequencies. Again, during calculation of optimal frequency which should not trigger up policy, down threshold to consider is difference between up_threshold_at_min_freq and down_differential. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand and PegasusQ) (Default: 60%)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_at_min_freq

seekBar.description: Measured in uS and actual meaning being Sampling Interval, this factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for HYPER, OnDemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Conservative, Scary, Sleepy, Nightmare, Darkness, zzmoove) (Default: 60.000 uS)
seekBar.name: sampling_rate

seekBar.description: Acts as a multiplier for sampling interval for re-evaluating the load when CPU is truly busy and is on highest clock frequency (policy max). Setting to 1 makes no difference and causes CPU to immediately scale down from highest frequency. Sampling down factor is NOT valid for lower frequencies and low load conditions. Note that CPU is scaled up to max frequency when max_load_freq is greater than up_threshold X current frequency. (or to cur_freq + (freq_step X policy.max_freq) whichever is smaller) Max_load_freq is an arbitrary frequency calculated as the maximum of load_frequencies. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Conservartive, Scary, Sleepy, zzmoove) (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: sampling_down_factor

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should increase CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches up_threshold or inc_cpu_load. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, PegasusQ, Nightmare, Conservative, Scary, zzmoove) (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: freq_step

seekBar.description: After spending sampling_down_factor X sampling_rate micro seconds at maximum frequency on high load, governor samples the load again to calculate an approx target frequency to scale-down-to which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sample. (Triggering up threshold may cause jumping to max frequency again). Max_load_freq is checked against (up_threshold - down_differential) X current frequency. If found to be smaller, CPU is scaled down to a target frequency as described above. Down_differential also act as the factor to prevent aggressive scale down. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Sleepy) (default: 5)
seekBar.name: down_differential

seekBar.description: Until freq_for_responsiveness, Up Threshold considered for sampling load is up_threshold_at_min_freq. Also during the part where CPU is at maximum load frequency, governor need to find the optimal frequency as the next frequency - which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sampling. When such a frequency_next is found to be a) less than freq_for_responsiveness b) will not trigger down_threshold in the next sample, then the optimal frequency is set to freq_for_responsiveness. (Only for HYPER, PegasusQ, Nightmare) (Default: 400.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: freq_for_responsiveness

seekBar.description: This is same as the up_threshold found for the Ondemand governor but for the opposite direction. For example when set to its default value of 30 it means that if the CPU usage needs to be below 30% between samples to have the frequency decreased. (Only for Conservative, Scary, zzmoove) (Default: 30%)
seekBar.name: down_threshold

settingsPane.description: Nightmare and Darkness Gov Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: NIGHTMARE | DARKNESS GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: No of samples to evaluate load to scale CPU Up. After cpu_up_rate samples are finished for a frequency, CPU scale-Up logic is executed. In other words - before scaling Up, cpu_up_rate X up_sample_time micro seconds are spend at a frequency. (Only for Nightmare when his hotplugging is Enabled) (Default: 10)
seekBar.name: cpu_up_rate

seekBar.description: No of samples to evaluate load to scale CPU Down. After CPU_down_rate samples are finished for a frequency, CPU scale-Down logic is executed. In other words - before scaling Down, cpu_down_rate X down_sample_time micro seconds are spend at a frequency. (Only for Nightmare when his hotplugging is Enabled) (Default: 20)
seekBar.name: cpu_down_rate

seekBar.description: This threshold is used as up threshold while sampling at frequencies less than freq_for_responsiveness. Above that, normal inc_cpu_load is used. This gives us an option to make scaling aggressive/relaxed until a frequency and normal for higher frequencies. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 60%)
seekBar.name: inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU up. Load big or equal inc_cpu_load: cpu scaled up. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 70%)
seekBar.name: inc_cpu_load

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU down. Load less than dec_cpu_load: cpu scaled down. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 50%)
seekBar.name: dec_cpu_load

seekBar.description: When current freq is greater than freq_for_responsiviness_max, freq_step_dec will be equal to freq_step_dec_at_max_freq. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 1200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: freq_for_responsiveness_max

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should increase CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for nightmare). (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_at_min_freq

seekBar.description: Brake scale up frequency when load big or equal inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 30)
seekBar.name: freq_up_brake_at_min_freq

seekBar.description: Brake scale up frequency when load big or equal inc_cpu_load. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 30)
seekBar.name: freq_up_brake

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should decrease CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches dec_cpu_load. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 10%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_dec

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should decrease CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches dec_cpu_load and current freq is greater than freq_for_responsiviness_max. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 10%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_dec_at_max_freq

seekBar.description: Basically if the next step target frequency drop inside the range of 100 mhz, cpu will decide if the frequency shift will be loudly enough, so that higher than the parameter value. This will act so that the next target frequency will be one step higher than before. Let us suppose that the actual frequency is 600 Mhz, and the target one is gonna be 721 Mhz. Target frequency is within the range that goes from 700 to 800 Mhz, Computing will be therefeore 721-700= 21 Mhz. If the obtained value(for this sample will be 21) is gonna be greater than the parameter value, the target frequency will upgrade its own value to 800 Mhz, instead, if the value(21) will be smaller or equal than the parameter value, target frequency will be 700 Mhz. An higher value means performance reduction. (Nightmare, Darkness). (Default: 0)
seekBar.name: up_sf_step

seekBar.description: Basically if the next step target frequency drop inside the range of 100 mhz, cpu will decide if the frequency shift will be loudly enough, so that higher than the parameter value. This will act so that the next target frequency will be one step higher than before. Let us suppose that the actual frequency is 600 Mhz, and the target one is gonna be 421 Mhz. Target frequency is within the range that goes from 400 to 500 Mhz, Computing will be therefeore 421-400= 21 Mhz. If the obtained value(for this sample will be 21) is gonna be greater than the parameter value, the target frequency will upgrade its own value to 500 Mhz, instead, if the value(21) will be smaller or equal than the parameter value, target frequency will be 400 Mhz. An higher value means performance reduction. (Nightmare, Darkness). (Default: 0)
seekBar.name: down_sf_step

spinner.description: Enabling or Disabling Nightmare Governor Hotplugging. If this options is set to Enabled, Intelli plug hotplugging will be disabled! It will be automatically restored when the chosen governor is different from Nightmare, Darkness or this option is set to disabled. (Default: Enabled)
spinner.name: hotplug_enable

seekBar.description: Up threshold frequency to turn second core On, when some other conditions is also met. ie If (minimum frequency greater than or equal to hotplug_freq 1 1 and run queue length is greater than hotplug_rq 1 1) Hotplug IN Second Core. Higher value correpsonds to delay in turning on second core. (Only when Nightmare, Darkness hotplugging is Enabled) (Default: 500.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: hotplug_freq_fst

seekBar.description: Down threshold frequency to turn second core Off, when some other conditions is also met. ie If (maximum frequency less than hotplug_freq 2 0 and run queue length is less than or equal to hotplug_rq 2 0) Hotplug OUT Second Core. Lower value correpsonds to delay in turning off second core. (Only when Nightmare, Darkness hotplugging is Enabled) (Default: 200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: hotplug_freq_snd

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU up. Cur Load equal or greater than up_load: Cpu Hotplug IN. Value corresponding to 101 causes not HOTPLUG IN. (Only when Nightmare, Darkness hotplugging is Enabled) (Default: 65%)
seekBar.name: up_load

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU down. Cur Load less than down_load: Cpu Hotplug OUT. Value corresponding to 101 causes immediately HOTPLUG OUT. (Only when Nightmare, Darkness hotplugging is Enabled) (Default: 30%)
seekBar.name: down_load

spinner.description: When this option is enabled, governor will force cpu to go among configured frequencies following cpu policy limit. Possible steps are: 16 (100...1600 mHz), 12 (100, 200, 400, 500, 600, 800, 1000, 1100, 1200, 1300, 1400, 1500 mHz), 10 (100, 200, 400, 500, 600, 800, 1000, 1200, 1300, 1500 mHz), 8 (100, 200, 500, 800, 1000, 1200, 1300, 1500 mHz). This option is valid for awake and sleep and only with Darkness governor. (Default: 16)
spinner.name: force_freqs_step

settingsPane.description: ZZMOOVE Gov Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: ZZMOOVE GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Max sampling down factor which should be set by momentum (0 disable momentum, possible range from sampling_down_factor up to 100000. (Default: 0)
seekBar.name: sampling_down_max_mom

seekBar.description: How fast the sampling down factor should be switched (possible values from 1 to 500. (Default: 50)
seekBar.name: sampling_down_mom_sens

seekBar.description: Hotplug threshold for cpu1 (0 disable core1, possible range from down_threshold up to 100) (Default: 68%)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_hp_fst

seekBar.description: Hotplug threshold for cpu1 (possible range from 11 to under up_threshold). (Default: 55%)
seekBar.name: down_threshold_hp_fst

seekBar.description: Hotplug up frequency threshold for core1. Possible values 0 disable and range from over down_threshold_hotplug_freq1 to max scaling frequency. (Default: 0 kHz)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_hp_freq_fst

seekBar.description: Hotplug down frequency threshold for core1. Possible values 0 disable and range from min scaling to under up_threshold_hotplug_freq1 frequency. (Default: 0 kHz)
seekBar.name: down_threshold_hp_freq_fst

seekBar.description: This modification makes the governor use two lookup tables holding current, next and previous frequency to directly get a correct target frequency instead of calculating target frequencies with up_threshold and step_up percentage. The two scaling lookup tables used contain different scaling steps/frequencies to achieve faster upscaling on higher CPU load. (Default: 75%)
seekBar.name: smooth_up

seekBar.description: Limit frequency. (possible values 0 disable limit, 100000 kHz - 1600000 kHz) (Default: 0 kHz)
seekBar.name: freq_limit

seekBar.description: 1-4 number of scaling jumps only for upscaling, 5-8 equivalent to 1-4 for up and down scaling. (Default: 0)
seekBar.name: fast_scaling

spinner.description: Switch to enable/disable early demand functionality (possible values 0 disable or 1 enable. (Default: Disabled)
spinner.name: early_demand

seekBar.description: Scale up frequency if the load goes up in one step of grad up value. (Default: 50%)
seekBar.name: grad_up_threshold

spinner.description: Switch to enable/disable hotplugging (possible values are any value above 0 to disable hotplugging and 0 to enable it. (Default: Enabled)
spinner.name: disable_hotplug

settingsPane.description: Here you can manage advanced governor settings. These settings are only active when the screen is off. !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process and CortexBrain-CPU-Tweaks!!!
settingsPane.name: Governor Parameters tuning

spinner.description: This will set the DEEP SLEEP (screen off) CPU governor.
spinner.name: Deep-Sleep! CPU Governor

settingsPane.description: Global Govs Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: GLOBAL GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Measured as percentage, when load on CPU is equal to above up threshold, CPU is scaled Up. Lower value - early scale up, and vice-verse. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Conservative, Scary, Sleepy, zzmoove) (Default: 70%)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_sleep

seekBar.description: This threshold is used as up threshold while sampling at frequencies less than freq_for_responsiveness. Above that, normal up_threshold is used. This gives us an option to make scaling aggressive or relaxed until a frequency and normal for higher frequencies. Again, during calculation of optimal frequency which should not trigger up policy, down threshold to consider is difference between up_threshold_at_min_freq and down_differential. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand and PegasusQ) (Default: 60%)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_at_min_freq_sleep

seekBar.description: Measured in uS and actual meaning being Sampling Interval, this factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for HYPER, OnDemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Conservative, Scary, Sleepy, Nightmare, Darkness, zzmoove) (Default: 60.000 uS)
seekBar.name: sampling_rate_sleep

seekBar.description: Acts as a multiplier for sampling interval for re-evaluating the load when CPU is truly busy and is on highest clock frequency (policy max). Setting to 1 makes no difference and causes CPU to immediately scale down from highest frequency. Sampling down factor is NOT valid for lower frequencies and low load conditions. Note that CPU is scaled up to max frequency when max_load_freq is greater than up_threshold X current frequency. (or to cur_freq + (freq_step X policy.max_freq) whichever is smaller) Max_load_freq is an arbitrary frequency calculated as the maximum of load_frequencies. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Conservartive, Scary, Sleepy, zzmoove) (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: sampling_down_factor_sleep

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should increase CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches up_threshold or inc_cpu_load. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, PegasusQ, Nightmare, Conservative, Scary, zzmoove) (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_sleep

seekBar.description: After spending sampling_down_factor X sampling_rate micro seconds at maximum frequency on high load, governor samples the load again to calculate an approx target frequency to scale-down-to which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sample. (Triggering up threshold may cause jumping to max frequency again). Max_load_freq is checked against (up_threshold - down_differential) X current frequency. If found to be smaller, CPU is scaled down to a target frequency as described above. Down_differential also act as the factor to prevent aggressive scale down. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Sleepy) (Default: 5)
seekBar.name: down_differential_sleep

seekBar.description: Until freq_for_responsiveness, Up Threshold considered for sampling load is up_threshold_at_min_freq. Also during the part where CPU is at maximum load frequency, governor need to find the optimal frequency as the next frequency - which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sampling. When such a frequency_next is found to be a) less than freq_for_responsiveness b) will not trigger down_threshold in the next sample, then the optimal frequency is set to freq_for_responsiveness. (Only for HYPER, PegasusQ, Nightmare) (Default: 400.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: freq_for_responsiveness_sleep

seekBar.description: This is same as the up_threshold found for the Ondemand governor but for the opposite direction. For example when set to its default value of 30 it means that if the CPU usage needs to be below 30% between samples to have the frequency decreased. (Only for Conservative, Scary, zzmoove) (Default: 30%)
seekBar.name: down_threshold_sleep

settingsPane.description: Nightmare and Darkness Gov Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: NIGHTMARE | DARKNESS GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate load to scale CPU Up. After cpu_up_rate samples are finished for a frequency, CPU scale-Up logic is executed. In other words - before scaling Up, cpu_up_rate X up_sample_time micro seconds are spend at a frequency. (Only for Nightmare when his hotplugging is Enabled) (Default: 20)
seekBar.name: cpu_up_rate_sleep

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate load to scale CPU Down. After CPU_down_rate samples are finished for a frequency, CPU scale-Down logic is executed. In other words - before scaling Down, cpu_down_rate X down_sample_time micro seconds are spend at a frequency. (Only for Nightmare when his hotplugging is Enabled) (Default: 20)
seekBar.name: cpu_down_rate_sleep

seekBar.description: This threshold is used as up threshold while sampling at frequencies less than freq_for_responsiveness. Above that, normal inc_cpu_load is used. This gives us an option to make scaling aggressive/relaxed until a frequency and normal for higher frequencies. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 60%)
seekBar.name: inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq_sleep

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU up. Load big or equal inc_cpu_load: cpu scaled up. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 70%)
seekBar.name: inc_cpu_load_sleep

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU down. Load less than dec_cpu_load: cpu scaled down. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 60%)
seekBar.name: dec_cpu_load_sleep

seekBar.description: When current freq is greater than freq_for_responsiviness_max, freq_step_dec will be equal to freq_step_dec_at_max_freq. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 1200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: freq_for_responsiveness_max_sleep

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should increase CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_at_min_freq_sleep

seekBar.description: Brake scale up frequency when load big or equal inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 30)
seekBar.name: freq_up_brake_at_min_freq_sleep

seekBar.description: Brake scale up frequency when load big or equal inc_cpu_load. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 30)
seekBar.name: freq_up_brake_sleep

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should decrease CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches dec_cpu_load. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 10%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_dec_sleep

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should decrease CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches dec_cpu_load and current freq is greater than freq_for_responsiviness_max. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 10%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_dec_at_max_freq_sleep

seekBar.description: Basically if the next step target frequency drop inside the range of 100 mhz, cpu will decide if the frequency shift will be loudly enough, so that higher than the parameter value. This will act so that the next target frequency will be one step higher than before. Let us suppose that the actual frequency is 600 Mhz, and the target one is gonna be 721 Mhz. Target frequency is within the range that goes from 700 to 800 Mhz, Computing will be therefeore 721-700= 21 Mhz. If the obtained value(for this sample will be 21) is gonna be greater than the parameter value, the target frequency will upgrade its own value to 800 Mhz, instead, if the value(21) will be smaller or equal than the parameter value, target frequency will be 700 Mhz. An higher value means performance reduction. (Nightmare, Darkness). (Default: 0)
seekBar.name: up_sf_step_sleep

seekBar.description: Basically if the next step target frequency drop inside the range of 100 mhz, cpu will decide if the frequency shift will be loudly enough, so that higher than the parameter value. This will act so that the next target frequency will be one step higher than before. Let us suppose that the actual frequency is 600 Mhz, and the target one is gonna be 421 Mhz. Target frequency is within the range that goes from 400 to 500 Mhz, Computing will be therefeore 421-400= 21 Mhz. If the obtained value(for this sample will be 21) is gonna be greater than the parameter value, the target frequency will upgrade its own value to 500 Mhz, instead, if the value(21) will be smaller or equal than the parameter value, target frequency will be 400 Mhz. An higher value means performance reduction. (Nightmare, Darkness). (Default: 0)
seekBar.name: down_sf_step_sleep

seekBar.description: Up threshold frequency to turn second core On, when some other conditions is also met. ie If (minimum frequency greater than or equal to hotplug_freq 1 1 and run queue length is greater than hotplug_rq 1 1) Hotplug IN Second Core. Higher value correpsonds to delay in turning on second core. (Only when Nightmare, Darkness hotplugging is Enabled) (Default: 500.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: hotplug_freq_fst_sleep

seekBar.description: Down threshold frequency to turn second core Off, when some other conditions is also met. ie If (maximum frequency less than hotplug_freq 2 0 and run queue length is less than or equal to hotplug_rq 2 0) Hotplug OUT Second Core. Lower value correpsonds to delay in turning off second core. (Only when Nightmare, Darkness hotplugging is Enabled) (Default: 200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: hotplug_freq_snd_sleep

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU up. Cur Load equal or greater than up_load: Cpu Hotplug IN. Value corresponding to 101 causes not HOTPLUG IN. (Only when Nightmare, Darkness hotplugging is Enabled) (Default: 65%)
seekBar.name: up_load_sleep

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU down. Cur Load less than down_load: Cpu Hotplug OUT. Value corresponding to 101 causes immediately HOTPLUG OUT. (Only when Nightmare, Darkness hotplugging is Enabled) (Default: 30%)
seekBar.name: down_load_sleep

settingsPane.description: ZZMOOVE Gov Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: ZZMOOVE GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Max sampling down factor which should be set by momentum (0 disable momentum, possible range from sampling_down_factor up to 100000. (Default: 0)
seekBar.name: sampling_down_max_mom_sleep

seekBar.description: How fast the sampling down factor should be switched (possible values from 1 to 500. (Default: 50)
seekBar.name: sampling_down_mom_sens_sleep

seekBar.description: Hotplug threshold for cpu1 (0 disable core1, possible range from down_threshold up to 100) (Default: 68%)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_hp_fst_sleep

seekBar.description: Hotplug threshold for cpu1 (possible range from 11 to under up_threshold). (Default: 55%)
seekBar.name: down_threshold_hp_fst_sleep

seekBar.description: Hotplug up frequency threshold for core1. Possible values 0 disable and range from over down_threshold_hotplug_freq1 to max scaling frequency. (Default: 0 kHz)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_hp_freq_fst_sleep

seekBar.description: Hotplug down frequency threshold for core1. Possible values 0 disable and range from min scaling to under up_threshold_hotplug_freq1 frequency. (Default: 0 kHz)
seekBar.name: down_threshold_hp_freq_fst_sleep

seekBar.description: This modification makes the governor use two lookup tables holding current, next and previous frequency to directly get a correct target frequency instead of calculating target frequencies with up_threshold and step_up percentage. The two scaling lookup tables used contain different scaling steps/frequencies to achieve faster upscaling on higher CPU load. (Default: 100%)
seekBar.name: smooth_up_sleep

seekBar.description: Limit frequency. (possible values 0 disable limit, 100000 kHz - 1600000 kHz) (Default: 0 kHz)
seekBar.name: freq_limit_sleep

seekBar.description: 1-4 number of scaling jumps only for upscaling, 5-8 equivalent to 1-4 for up and down scaling. (Default: 0)
seekBar.name: fast_scaling_sleep

spinner.description: Switch to enable/disable early demand functionality (possible values 0 disable or 1 enable. (Default: Disabled)
spinner.name: early_demand_sleep

seekBar.description: Scale up frequency if the load goes up in one step of grad up value. (Default: 50%)
seekBar.name: grad_up_threshold_sleep

spinner.description: Switch to enable/disable hotplugging (possible values are any value above 0 to disable hotplugging and 0 to enable it. (Default: Enabled)
spinner.name: disable_hotplug_sleep

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune IO settings managed by Kernel
settingsPane.name: IO Tuning

spinner.description: Maximum number of kilobytes to read-ahead for EXTERNAL SDCARD! file systems on this device. Best to leave it AUTO, then script will detect your external sdcard size and set the best value for it! the INTERNAL sdcard will get 1024kB as default and best for 16GB storage, Works only if IO-Tweaks tweak is enabled! (Default: 128 kB) !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
spinner.name: kilobytes to read-ahead

spinner.description: This will set the default AWAKE IO scheduler for internal, system, data and external sdcard. (Default: BFQ)
spinner.name: Default Awake IO Scheduler

spinner.description: This will set the STANDBY and DEEPSLEEP IO scheduler for internal, system, data and external sdcard. (Default: BFQ) !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
spinner.name: STANDBY and DEEPSLEEP IO Scheduler

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune memory and OOM (low mem management) settings managed by Kernel.
settingsPane.name: Memory Tuning

checkbox.description: Enable AUTO OOM control using below profiles, disable if you want to set your own OOM tuning via APP or Script.
checkbox.name: Auto OOM
checkbox.label: AUTO OOM CONTROL

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low mem management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive, equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen ON

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low mem management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen OFF

seekBar.description: Dirty background memory buffer, more you set, more memory will be used for write buffer for background operations. Buffer is released on need to free RAM (Default: 15%)
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

seekBar.description: Dirty real time memory buffer, more you set, more memory will be used for write buffer for real time operations. Buffer is released on need to free RAM (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

button.description: Clean RAM Cache. This will release all cached and buffered RAM, please WAIT 3sec to get cleanup report
button.name: CLEAN RAM CACHE
button.label: CLEAN RAM CACHE NOW

spinner.description: ZRAM Module settings. Here you can shut down ZRAM or add more compressed RAM for your system.
spinner.name: ZRAM Settings

spinner.description: If you have enabled swap, then the higher a number set here, the more the system will swap. (Default: 0)
spinner.name: swappiness

button.description: ZRAM state check
button.name: ZRAM STATS
button.label: ZRAM STATS

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Ultra KSM Control. This will merge some memory but need cpu-power + battery. This depends on cortex background, so you have to stop and start the servive or reboot your phone.
checkbox.name: Ultra KSM Control
checkbox.label: Ultra KSM Control

button.description: Ultra KSM state check
button.name: Ultra KSM STATS
button.label: Ultra KSM STATS

settingsPane.description: GPU Frequency, voltage, and steps utilization settings. Defaults frequencies are 108, 160, 200, 267 and 267. Voltage defaults are 950mV, 950mV, 1000mV, 1050mV and 1050mV.
settingsPane.name: GPU Control

checkbox.description: Enabling VPLL mode may be unstable on some devices so do not complain if your device lags or crashes (SOD). If you do not use VPLL Mode, the following frequency steps will be unavailable: 330, 440, 520. VPLL is a new frqeuency range to give some users more GPU performance. USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
checkbox.name: VPLL Mode
checkbox.label: VPLL Mode

seekBar.description: Here you can change GPU utilization timeout calculation. Closer to 100 (0.1sec) and you will get faster GPU response in steps jump on load, but more battery is drained. CM10 default: 1000 (1sec)
seekBar.name: GPU Utilization Timeout

spinner.description: Changes the first (lowest) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 1

spinner.description: Changes the second GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 2

spinner.description: Changes the third GPU frequency step. WARNING! 400 MHz needs 1150 mV - 1200 mV. Above 1300 mV you risk to burn your chip!
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 3

spinner.description: Changes the fourth GPU frequency step. WARNING! 400, 440, 520 MHz needs 1300 mV - 1450 mV. (520Mhz stable on 1400mV+ if your chip can handle that) Above 1300 mV you risk to burn your chip!
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 4

spinner.description: Changes the fifth GPU frequency step. WARNING! 400, 440, 520 MHz needs 1300 mV - 1450 mV. (520Mhz stable on 1400mV+ if your chip can handle that) Above 1300 mV you risk to burn your chip!
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 5

settingsPane.description: GPU Voltage Levels: The defaults are 950, 950, 950, 1000 and 1050. WARNING! Voltage above 1300 mV can put your device to risk! Do not blame me if GPU chip burned.
settingsPane.name: GPU Voltage Levels

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the first step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level 1

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the second step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level 2

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the third step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level 3

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level 4

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the fifth step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level 5

settingsPane.description: GPU load thresholds to change between frequency steps.
settingsPane.name: GPU Thresholds

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from first to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 1-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from second to first step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from second to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from third to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from third to fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from fourth to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 4-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from fourth to fifth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 4-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from fifth to fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 5-DOWN

settingsPane.description: Brightness Curve settings. Modifies auto-brightness behavior.
settingsPane.name: Brightness Curve

seekBar.description: Setting min_bl higher will result in staying in the lowest brightness level for brighter conditions. (Default: 30)
seekBar.name: min_bl

seekBar.description: Minimum brightness level. (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: min_gamma

seekBar.description: Maximum brightness level. (Default and MAX: 23)
seekBar.name: max_gamma

checkbox.description: LCD Power Reduce for backlight. If you like brighter screen in cost of battery drain, then turn it off. (Default: On)
checkbox.name: LCD POWER
checkbox.label: LCD POWER REDUCE

settingsPane.description: Settings for screen color by user manual input
settingsPane.name: Screen color menu

button.description: Push to reset screen color to default
button.name: Reset color to default
button.label: Default Color

seekBar.description: Sets screen BLUE color scale. (Default: 127)
seekBar.name: Blue Color Scale

seekBar.description: Sets screen RED color scale. (Default: 127)
seekBar.name: Red Color Scale

checkbox.description: mDNIe sharpness tweaks from hardcore. Requires reboot to be effective.
checkbox.name: mDNIe sharpness tweaks by GM!
checkbox.label: mDNIe Sharpness Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Other Settings
settingsPane.name: Other Settings

seekBar.description: User adjustable gamma shift. (Default: 0)
seekBar.name: Gamma shift

seekBar.description: FB earlysuspend delay to run CRT animation when you turn the screen off.
seekBar.name: FB early suspend delay

seekBar.description: Vibration force level. (Default: 75)
seekBar.name: Vibration force

checkbox.description: Slide2Wake By Fluxi@xda. When screen is turned off, swipe from the left side of the screen to the right side of the screen, and the screen will be turned on!
checkbox.name: Slide2Wake ON or OFF switch
checkbox.label: Slide2Wake Switch

checkbox.description: Enable inverting screen colors by quickly pressing Home button.
checkbox.name: mDNIe Negative Toggle
checkbox.label: mDNIe Negative Toggle

spinner.description: Negative Color. Screen effect settings. Fast clicking Home button for the number of times configured will activate MOD.
spinner.name: Negative Screen Mod tuning.

settingsPane.description: Here you can control kernel screen gestures, set at data - gesture_set.sh. More can be added by user. !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
settingsPane.name: Gestures panel

checkbox.description: Here you can turn on or off kernel built in gestures! See OP for instructions or ask in forum.
checkbox.name: Gestures switch
checkbox.label: Gestures switch

button.description: Click to reset gestures to default, or update with new one from dev. Gesture file will be added to data only if it is missing.
button.name: Reset gestures
button.label: Reset Gestures

settingsPane.description: Touchscreen configuration on battery and on charge. !ALERT! Wrong settings will disable touch screen! You will have to reset profiles in recovery! Also, settings for battery and charger are different! Do not set the same levels! Have fun tuning.
settingsPane.name: Touch screen MX224 sensitivity

button.description: Click to see your touch screen type and active touch configuration, it is can be TSP MX224 or MX224E, so if you want to configure, do it for your type.
button.name: Check Touch Screen info
button.label: Check Touch Screen

seekBar.description: MX224 Touchscreen on BATTERY (Touch Threshold) (Default: 50)
seekBar.name: BATT Touch Treshold

seekBar.description: MX224 Touchscreen on BATTERY (Noise Threshold) (Default: 40)
seekBar.name: BATT Noise Treshold

seekBar.description: MX224 Touchscreen on BATTERY (Move Filter) (Default: 12)
seekBar.name: BATT Move Filter

seekBar.description: MX224 Touchscreen on CHARGER or USB (Touch Threshold) (Default: 53)
seekBar.name: CHRG Touch Treshold

seekBar.description: MX224 Touchscreen on CHARGER or USB (Noise Threshold) (Default: 38)
seekBar.name: CHRG Noise Treshold

seekBar.description: MX224 Touchscreen on CHARGER or USB (Move Filter) (Default: 47)
seekBar.name: CHRG Move Filter

settingsPane.description: Touch Screen configuration for TSP MX224E only! all the warnings and info above, effect here the same
settingsPane.name: Touch screen MX224E sensitivity

seekBar.description: MX224E Touchscreen on BATTERY (Touch Threshold_e) (Default: 50)
seekBar.name: BATT Touch Treshold E

seekBar.description: MX224E Touchscreen on BATTERY (Move Filter_e) (Default: 12)
seekBar.name: BATT Move Filter E

seekBar.description: MX224E Touchscreen on CHARGER or USB (Touch Threshold_e) (Default: 42)
seekBar.name: CHRG Touch Treshold E

seekBar.description: MX224E Touchscreen on CHARGER or USB (Move Filter_e) (Default: 47)
seekBar.name: CHRG Move Filter E

settingsPane.description: JB ROM low sound bug fix on boot
settingsPane.name: LOW SOUND FIX

checkbox.description: Dirty Hack for JB ROM low Sound after boot. This patch will push the Vol DOWN and Vol UP for you on boot, and fix the low sound or ring every boot. You will see the volume slider moving! That is how it is fixed. Also it will reset the silence state if it was set before boot. If you have an ICS ROM, just ignore this, it will not be used, ICS ROMs do not have the bug. Fix is OFF by default, if you set ON, effect will be on boot only.
checkbox.name: JB low sound fix on boot
checkbox.label: JB low sound fix on boot

settingsPane.description: Master headphone gain (amplification) settings, thanks to Gokhanmoral!
settingsPane.name: Headphone Amplification

spinner.description: Headphone amplifier level (0-3 which corresponds to 0dB, 1.5dB, 3dB, 6dB)
spinner.name: Headphone Amplifier

settingsPane.description: Master Analog gain + headphone amplification + speaker amplification + Mic gain
settingsPane.name: Volume Levels and Gain Control

seekBar.description: Master volume, gain power level, affects all channels
seekBar.name: Master volume gain

seekBar.description: Headphone amplification level
seekBar.name: Headphone volume level

seekBar.description: Analog mic gain level
seekBar.name: Mic volume Level

seekBar.description: Analog speaker level
seekBar.name: Speaker volume level

settingsPane.description: BackLightNotification and Touch Keys related Settings
settingsPane.name: BackLightNotification

spinner.description: This setting will set LED behavior for BLN, !README! if BLNWW is ON(see below)! then effect is ONLY Steady! and will be reset to !Steady!
spinner.name: BLN Effect

spinner.description: Notification timeout, !README! if BLNWW is ON(see below)! this setting it ignored and reset to !Never timeout!
spinner.name: notification_timeout

settingsPane.description: Touch keys light settings. Here you can set the way touch keys light work.
settingsPane.name: Touch keys lights settings

spinner.description: LED timeout. Select Use ROM defaults if your ROM already has LED timeout support (requires restart). You will need to use this setting on Samsung ROMs if you want to use LED fadeout effect.
spinner.name: led_timeout

checkbox.description: BLN Without Wakelock. You cannot use blinking or breathing BLN effects together with this option, also no BLN timeout! BLN will be active till screen is ON!. Enabling this will let the CPU sleep during BLN and save battery.
checkbox.name: BLNWW
checkbox.label: BLNWW

checkbox.description: Led fadeout effect. If you are on a Samsung ROM, you need to set Touch Keys LEDs to always on or always off and use LED timeout in STweaks.
checkbox.name: Led fadeout
checkbox.label: Led fadeout

checkbox.description: Selecting this will activate turning touckey LEDs on when you touch the screen (only when LED timeout is enabled).
checkbox.name: Leds on with touch
checkbox.label: led-on-touch

button.description: Use this button to test BLN. BLN will be active after you turn the screen off.
button.name: Test BLN
button.label: Test BLN

seekBar.description: Controls touchpad LED voltage level. (Default: 3000)
seekBar.name: LED voltage level

checkbox.description: Automatic touchpad LED voltage level. If this one is checked, touchpad LED voltage level will be ignored.
checkbox.name: Auto LED voltage
checkbox.label: Auto Led Voltage

settingsPane.description: Here you can activate some scripts, which will automatically run in the background, at a specified time.
settingsPane.name: cron

spinner.description: Main switch for Cron Tasker. If you set this to OFF, then all tasks below have no effect!
spinner.name: CRON TASK MAIN SWITCH

button.description: Use this button to test if this Cron Task service is ONLINE and supported! If main switch is ON, and service is OFFLINE, then ROM Busybox is not supporting Cron. Update Busybox or ROM for this to work.
button.name: Test Cron Task Service
button.label: Test Cron Task Service

button.description: Use this button to RESET the scripts and jobs from kernel, to refresh the configuration. This will clear all your custom changes!
button.name: CRON RESET
button.label: RESET CRON

checkbox.description: Cron to clear file-cache every hour, but only if CPU is resting (IDLE) and more than 50% of your memory is used! This will free RAM from unused buffers and cache.
checkbox.name: Clean file-cache
checkbox.label: RAM cache clean every Hour

checkbox.description: Cron to update AD-BLOCKER every week at SAT 6:00AM UTC time, from official site. The script will check, if you are connected with the internet, otherwise it will try to use WIFI! Script will turn wifi, wait for connection and update, then when it is finished it will turn WIFI off. If there is no connection, an error will be written in the log.
checkbox.name: Update AD-Block
checkbox.label: Update AD-BLOCKER every week

checkbox.description: Cron to DB Optimize every day at 3:00AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)!
checkbox.name: DB Optimization
checkbox.label: DB Optimization task every day at 3:00AM

checkbox.description: Cron to clear app-cache every day at 4:00AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)!
checkbox.name: Clean app-cache
checkbox.label: Disk Clean task every day at 4:00AM

checkbox.description: Cron to fix app-permissions every day at 4:40AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)! This can help to reduce errors, bugs, and applications FC.
checkbox.name: Fix app-permissions
checkbox.label: Permissions fix every day at 4:40AM

checkbox.description: Cron to zipalign app is every day at 4:50AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)! This can help to reduce errors, bugs, applications FC, and improve applications load speed. WARNING! Bakcup all apps before use! This process will remove apps that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing! USE it AT YOUR OWN RISK and update the broken applications!
checkbox.name: Zipalign Task
checkbox.label: Zipalign Task Every day at 4:50AM

button.description: Use this button to check if Cron Task Jobs are done as requested. This will show the log for all finished jobs.
button.name: Test Cron Task jobs
button.label: Test Cron Task Jobs

settingsPane.description: Here you can find some settings and options for your apps.
settingsPane.name: Apps

button.description: Click here to start fixing. Here you can run Fix Permissions, please click one time only, scripts will finish in max 2~3min, no reboot is needed.
button.name: FIX PERMISSIONS
button.label: FIX PERMISSIONS

button.description: Click here to start Zipaligning ONLY user apps. System may be unresponsive, it is OK, do not use phone for 2 minutes. WARNING! Backup all user applications before use! This process will remove applications that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing. USE it AT YOUR OWN RISK, and update the broken applications!.
button.name: ZIPALIGN
button.label: ZIPALIGN ALL APPS

button.description: Click here to start applications Database Optimization. Compacting, cleaning and indexing will take max 2min.
button.name: DB OPTIMIZATION
button.label: DATABASE OPTIMIZATON

settingsPane.description: WIFI Settings
settingsPane.name: WIFI

button.description: Clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease. Push the button to activate!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: Here you can find GPS and NTP settings and options.
settingsPane.name: GPS - NTP

spinner.description: GPS-Time-Zone for faster GPS lock! Use your region!
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS ZONE CHECK

button.description: Update time via NTP server
button.name: UPDATE TIME
button.label: UPDATE TIME

settingsPane.description: USB and SDCARD settings and options.
settingsPane.name: USB - SDCARD

spinner.description: Change USB connection mode. Either leave it as default or force it to mass storage mode (you will see your sdcards as disks) or MTP.
spinner.name: USB mass storage mode

checkbox.description: If checked, Mass-Storage-SDCARDS will be auto-mounted when USB connected. then you can transfer files on high speed from PC to device. (Default: On) !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
checkbox.name: Auto Mount USB Drives
checkbox.label: Auto Mount USB Drives

button.description: Dual Mount-SDCARD and MMC via USB. After USB is disconnected, Dual Mount is disabled! This tweak is working automatically. Plug USB, turn off the screen and then turn ON, and you get working mounts. To scan your new MEDIA files, use some app to force Media Scan.
button.name: DUAL MOUNT
button.label: Dual Mount

settingsPane.description: Charger, Battery settings and options. allowed mA is in range from 450mA to 650mA, by hardware limits! we cant set less or more
settingsPane.name: Battery Charge

seekBar.description: Battery AC Charge Current Setting
seekBar.name: Battery AC Charge Current

seekBar.description: Battery MISC Charge Current Setting
seekBar.name: Battery MISC Charge Current

seekBar.description: Battery USB Charge Current Setting
seekBar.name: Battery USB Charge Current

button.description: If you think that the fuel gauge chip is behaving weird use this button to reset it. Give it a few hours after you reset the gauge. It may still show you funny values for that period, then the battery percentage should be fine.
button.name: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip
button.label: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip

checkbox.description: If checked, BetterBatteryStatus will report discrete (non-overlapping) wake lock statistics.
checkbox.name: Discrete Wake lock Stats
checkbox.label: Discrete Wake lock Stats

settingsPane.description: Here you can Add, Update or Remove AD Blocker! You need ROOT to do the tweak! If you want to update the blocker, you can push the UPDATE AD NOW button, to get the new one installed! If you install a new ROM, and you want to use AD BLOCKER, then push UPDATE AD NOW and REBOOT. If you need to REMOVE AD-BLOCKER use the REMOVE button and REBOOT
settingsPane.name: AD Blocker

button.description: ADD or UPDATE AD BLOCKER
button.name: AD-B UPDATE or ADD
button.label: UPDATE AD-B NOW

button.description: REMOVE AD Blocker
button.name: AD-B REMOVE
button.label: REMOVE AD-B NOW

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable INIT.D scripts RUN on boot. Many new ROMS are running the init.d scripts automatically. You can also force running the scripts, but if you run them and ROM runs them too, we have a problem: all scripts are running X2 times! To avoid conflicts, Stweaks RUN-control is disabled by default. If you know that your ROM is NOT supporting init.d script running, then turn it ON here and reboot.
checkbox.name: INIT.D Scripts RUN control
checkbox.label: Enable INIT.D scripts RUN-control

settingsPane.description: Android Additional Logs
settingsPane.name: Logger

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Android Additional Logs (needs reboot)
checkbox.name: Android Logger
checkbox.label: Android Logger

settingsPane.description: Fixes file system only if needed!
settingsPane.name: FS

button.description: DATA, SYSTEM and CACHE file system check and repair on boot. !WARNING! This is a VERY DANGEROUS option! Before activating it DO A FULL BACKUP with Titanium Backup or any kind of backup application! If you have lots of damage in your DATA partition, after fix and repair, ROM may NOT BOOT anymore! In that case reinstall ROM, and if you still cannot boot, you will have to format DATA file system via recovery! USE IT AT YOUR OWN RISK! THIS FUNCTION IS NOT A TOY! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED! This function works only for main ROM and Preload partition !also can be the second ROM system!, second ROM data gets no effect, and by default function is OFF. It is also one time action, push the button to Activate, push again to Abort!
button.name: FIX File System on BOOT
button.label: FIX DATA ON or OFF

checkbox.description: Check and repair file system on every boot by auto. See the WARNING ABOVE! DO FULL BACKUP! this is the same thing! just every boot! if all clean then should be OK, Doesn't clean dalvik-cache
checkbox.name: Check and repair file system on every boot
checkbox.label: Check and repair file system on every boot

button.description: Clean the media cache on your sdcard. Push once to clean, push again to abort. You have to reboot for action to work!
button.name: Clean media-cache
button.label: FIX MEDIA ON or OFF

settingsPane.description: Remove OR Reinstall ROOT! You can have a ROOTED or not ROOTED phone.
settingsPane.name: Root

button.description: Root Install. Click to install ROOT (SuperUser) + ROM Busybox if existed. In case you have used the remove button, to Reinstall ROOT first REMOVE it! !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
button.name: ROOT INSTALL
button.label: INSTALL ROOT

button.description: Root Uninstall. Click to remove Any ROOT installed + Busybox (kernel Busybox remains, but is hidden from system) To install ROOT check the Auto-Install Root and REBOOT.
button.name: ROOT REMOVE
button.label: REMOVE ROOT

button.description: Root check. Click to see if you have ROOT or not
button.name: ROOT Check
button.label: ROOT CHECK

checkbox.description: If box is checked, root will be installed on the next restart.
checkbox.name: Auto-Install Root
checkbox.label: Auto-Install Root

settingsPane.description: This script will manipulate many kernel settings, based on chosen STweaks profile + settings and on screen state (ON or OFF) and we call it CortexBrain. To reset the kernel-settings, after you disable a tweak, you must reboot!
settingsPane.name: CortexBrain Tweaks

spinner.description: Enable or Disable the background-process from CortexBrain. If you disable it, you will lose the function that set different settings for screen state (ON or OFF).
spinner.name: Cortexbrain-Background-Process

button.description: Click to see if the CortexBrain-Background-Process is running or not.
button.name: Check Background-Process
button.label: CHECK SERVICE

spinner.description: Here you can control android logger logcat. If you set it to AUTO, then you will have logs only on screen is on. When screen will be off, logger will be disabled to save battery. If you set DEBUG, it will be working no matter what! If set to DISABLED, logging will be off, no matter what. If USB or Charger is connected and logger is set to AUTO, logging will not be disabled so we can debug. !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
spinner.name: Android Logger control

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the DATA turns off while screen is off function. !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
checkbox.name: Auto-DATA
checkbox.label: Force Auto-Data

seekBar.description: Here you can set a delay before DATA is forced to OFF when screen is turned off. !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Auto-DATA!!!
seekBar.name: DATA Turn Off Delay (in sec)

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the Wifi turns off while screen is off function. !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
checkbox.name: Auto-Wifi
checkbox.label: Force Auto-Wifi

seekBar.description: Here you can set a delay before WIFI is forced to OFF when screen is turned off. !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Auto-Wifi !!!
seekBar.name: WIFI Turn Off Delay (in sec)

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable ICMP only Firewall-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Firewall-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Firewall-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable TCP-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: TCP-Tweaks
checkbox.label: TCP-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable TCP-RAM-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: TCP-RAM-Tweaks
checkbox.label: TCP-RAM-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable IPv6 Network. !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
checkbox.name: IPv6 Tweaks
checkbox.label: IPv6

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable CPU-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: CPU-Tweaks
checkbox.label: CPU-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Memory-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Memory-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Memory-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Battery-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Battery-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Battery-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Eco-Tweaks. !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
checkbox.name: Eco-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Eco-Tweaks

spinner.description: From what percentage battery life, the eco-mode is activated? !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Eco-Tweaks !!!
spinner.name: Eco-Level

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable System-Tweak (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: System-Tweaks
checkbox.label: System-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Kernel-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Kernel-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Kernel-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable IO-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: IO-Tweaks
checkbox.label: IO-Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Here you can load on boot kernel modules that will allow some extra functions.
settingsPane.name: Kernel Modules

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Usb to Serial Modules. This will allow you to use usb to serial adapter to connect to ROUTERS and SWITCHES via console port. Effect only after reboot!
checkbox.name: USB to Serial
checkbox.label: Usb to Serial Modules

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable CIFS Module. This will allow to use apps that can mount internal storage and publish over network. User can access data and system over network. No support, effect only after reboot!
checkbox.name: CIFS Module
checkbox.label: CIFS Module

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable EDS Module, (Encrypted Data Store) lets you store your files in the encrypted container to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive information. you need app from google store (EDS, Paid or Lite)
checkbox.name: EDS Module
checkbox.label: EDS Module

settingsPane.description: You can check what profile is used right now.
settingsPane.name: Online Profile

button.description: This displays your currently used profile.
button.name: Profile Check
button.label: Profile Check

settingsPane.description: Here you can choose some profiles. You can also switch the default profiles (battery, default, performance) via Kernel-Recovery.
settingsPane.name: STweaks Profiles

settingsPane.description: Here you can backup or restore your profile after installing new kernel. When you restore your configuration, please wait till this app restarts with the new settings. Some settings will work only after reboot! Restore will take up to 30 sec, just wait here!
settingsPane.name: STweaks Settings Backup or Restore

button.description: Backup STweaks User Settings!
button.name: Settings Backup
button.label: BACKUP NOW

button.description: Restore STweaks User Settings!
button.name: Settings Restore
button.label: RESTORE NOW

settingsPane.description: Dual-Boot Settings. WARNING! No confirmation will be asked for reboot buttons!
settingsPane.name: Dual-Boot Settings

button.description: Reboot into custom recovery which let you configure, clone or backup the 2nd ROM
button.name: Reboot into ROM Recovery
button.label: Reboot into recovery

button.description: Reboot into 1st ROM
button.name: Reboot into 1st ROM
button.label: Reboot into 1st ROM

button.description: Reboot into 2nd ROM
button.name: Reboot into 2nd ROM
button.label: Reboot into 2nd ROM

checkbox.description: Check this if you do not want boot logo to be shown. If this options is checked boot logo will not be shown even if you have 2ndROM installed.
checkbox.name: No boot-logo
checkbox.label: No boot-logo

spinner.description: Default ROM to boot into. If you do not have 2nd ROM installed, 1st ROM will be booted. If you press the home or volume-down buttons during the boot logo the alternative ROM will be booted, i.e. 1st ROM will be booted if the default ROM selection is the 2nd ROM.
spinner.name: Default ROM

settingsPane.description: Debug to SD-Card sdcard
settingsPane.name: Bug-Report

button.description: Bug-Report for Kernel
button.name: Kernel-Bug
button.label: KERNEL-BUG

button.description: Bug-Report for Apps
button.name: App-Bug
button.label: APP-BUG

settingsPane.description: Show Storage status, you can see if you have errors in system, data, cache, efs or preloaded partitions, this will only SHOW if all OK, or there are errors! will not fix them.
settingsPane.name: Partitions Scan

button.description: Use this to check your data, system, cache, efs, and preloaded partitions for errors. This will not FIX any errors, just check! To fix, backup your files with some backups app, then push the data and cache fix button located at OTHER TAB. USE IT AT YOUR OWN RISK! Some data will be lost! You will need to restore broken apps + data, in case of boot loop, then reinstall ROM. If you are still stuck on boot, wipe and install thr ROM again! It is BETTER to have a clean partition then broken and unstable system.
button.name: Partition Status
button.label: Partition Status

settingsPane.description: Check if there is a new kernel-update available.
settingsPane.name: Kernel-Update

button.description: Check for Update
button.name: Kernel-Update
button.label: KERNEL-CHECK
